column4: Somehow there is a file in my home trashbin owned by root.  (used sudo instead of gksudo for gui) Anyway, does anyone know the absolute path to the trashbin so that I may go there and reowner the file?
(you only need sudo because there's a non-you-owned file in there; normally, you wouldn't put it there)
Did you get any other errors apart from that?
It looks like a kernal update?
I'm a little fearful when it comes to these kernal updates. :)
It looks like I do see more errors happened before I posted
What's the output when you run "whereis update-grub" in the terminal?
eep, that's not good. Give me a sec to look something up
okays, found it. Are you using a regular PC, or a Mac?
actually, nvm, it shouldn't matter. just issue from the terminal: sudo apt-get --reinstall install grub
that sends the TERM signal to all of username's processes. If that doesn't work, skill KILL -u username to kill (not graceful)
